channel.title: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?
channel.description:
menuID[menuLength] = [u]805[/u]
Would it be possible to change the "805" value in mudclient.class without having the source? I remember messing around with CFParse in past, what are similar programs nowadays?
Thanks.

item.title: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

You could probably do it with BCEL/ASM a lot easier, personally.

Just find out what instruction is being used to push it onto the stack, and look for that particular one, and change?
Other than that, give JBE a try.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?

item.title: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

http://up.omnom.us/dl.php?file=cfparse49018.exe
I wonder why no one has updated JAD to work with current java versions :<

Found a decompiler that I’m going to try later: http://java.decompiler.free.fr/

Read full topic
item.source: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?

item.title: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

dragonlord:

There is a program that will open a .class in readable format (in clear text java), but i can’t remember the name… There is a GREAT deobber floating around here somewhere -.-

Deobbers usually decompile the code to a readable format, but you wont be able to re-compile it, in other words a person without coding experience would get stuck.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?

item.source: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?

item.title: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“BuyMyJunk, post:7, topic:219581”][quote author=Tha Owner link=topic=288436.msg2333306#msg2333306 date=1215985657]

Google + Java Decompiler man.

Agree with Vrunk.

What I just said in my previous post. There are no decompilers out there that could output a flawless source code for a RSC client. Something always is missing.
[/quote]
deobfuscate it?[/quote]

Google came up with a bunch of hits to JDO, does it actually work properly / output a readable / compilable code?

[quote=“Vrunk, post:8, topic:219581”][quote author=Tha Owner link=topic=288436.msg2333273#msg2333273 date=1215984984]
If you got such a good decompiler please share. I doubt you would be able to decompile a client and then recompile it without spending a few days fixing errors.
[/quote]

If you have the skills to edit a class file successfully with a hex editor, then fixing errors from a decompiler is child’s play (unless of course the class files have been obfuscated, in which case I would actually recommend the hex editor).

Quit your bitching and work at it. Nobody’s going to do the work for you unless money is involved.[/quote]

To be honest, it does look he’s working at it. He’s not asking on HOW to do it, he’s just asking for similar / more up-to-date programs on how to achieve his goal / links to CFParse (googled it myself for like 2 seconds, first page looked like rubbish).

No need to flame.

Read full topic

@Vrunk wrote:

Tha Owner:

If you got such a good decompiler please share. I doubt you would be able to decompile a client and then recompile it without spending a few days fixing errors.

If you have the skills to edit a class file successfully with a hex editor, then fixing errors from a decompiler is child’s play (unless of course the class files have been obfuscated, in which case I would actually recommend the hex editor).

Quit your bitching and work at it. Nobody’s going to do the work for you unless money is involved.

item.title: Changing a value in mudclient.class with bytecode editor?
item.dc:creator: @Tha_Owner Tha Owner
item.description:
@Tha_Owner wrote:

vortex:

Idk I still use CFParse, you can do that with it

Hey, could you upload CFParse for me? I’ve found some other similar progs too and managed to change that value. But I just like CFParse + Jackie more.

[quote=“Vrunk, post:3, topic:219581”]Why?

If you want to edit it so badly that you’re stooping to the level of editing byte code with a hex editor, you should either find the source, or decompile the class file yourself.[/quote]

If you got such a good decompiler please share. I doubt you would be able to decompile a client and then recompile it without spending a few days fixing errors.

Read full topic
